Sugar {"&"} Flower
  • Client: Spec Work
  • Timing: 2022
  • Duration: 3 Months
  • Role: UX/UI Designer
The Backstory

To further develop my practical UX/UI Design skills, I completed a self-directed spec project for a mock business, “Sugar {"& "}Flower”. The inspiration for this project came when I was placing an order for a custom cake for my sister{"’"}s birthday and found that the ordering experience offered an opportunity for better design.

Mock brief: Sugar {"&"} Flower, a locally-owned cake shop wanted to increase sales of their custom (made-to-order) cakes. They felt that many customers weren{"’"}t aware of all the options for customization available and additionally the process for placing an order could be simplified. Their existing process for taking a custom cake order was a manual one - with orders being taken in-person or by phone/email. Their website did have a shopping cart and customers could purchase fresh-made cakes available each day from a rotating menu fairly seamlessly. But to purchase a custom cake, customers online were pointed to get in touch with the store directly. A key insight that they shared was that over the past year Instagram became a great source of new customers as the platform did a great job of showcasing the visual appeal of their cake designs.

Problem to Solve {"&"} Core Considerations

The problem of “How to improve the process for ordering a custom cake?” was clear, and to start answering that question, I began with noting the following core considerations:

  • - Improving the process of ordering a custom cake carried different meaning depending on the user (customer vs. shop employee vs shop owner)
  • - They already had a functional website with a shopping cart that could be leveraged towards a solution
  • - There was an opportunity to capitalize on the visual appeal of their cakes to enhance the ordering experience

Research {"&"} Inspiration

  • - Completed competitive analysis of process for taking custom cake orders online, noting key criteria from the experience like complexity, info capture, and use of visuals by competitors
  • - Researched other “made-to-order” online order experiences for inspiration (Domino’s Pizza Builder App, Nike By You Custom Shoes)
  • - Conducted informal iinterviews with actual cake shop/bakery owners

Research {"&"} Inspiration

  • - Completed competitive analysis of process for taking custom cake orders online, noting key criteria from the experience like complexity, info capture, and use of visuals by competitors
  • - Researched other “made-to-order” online order experiences for inspiration (Domino’s Pizza Builder App, Nike By You Custom Shoes)
  • - Conducted informal iinterviews with actual cake shop/bakery owners

  • - Conducted informal iinterviews with actual cake shop/bakery owners
